Rantjs

Procedurally generated text in JavaScript

  View Project Source   Spread the Word

Make a sentence

Supported tags

Here's a list of currently supported tags

[sep:\s|\n]
My favorite colors: [rep:2]{<color>}
[case:none|default|word|upper|lower|case|sentence]

Supported tokens

Here's a list of the currently supported tokens

<preposition> <firstname> <activity> <adj>
<adv> <amount> <color> <conj>
<country> <emo> <em> <face>
<greet> <surname> <noun> <sound>
<title> <place> <prefix> <prepos>
<pron> <quality> <rel> <sconj>
<substance> <timeadv> <timenoun> <unit>
<verbimg> <say> <verb> <vocal> <yn>

Supported Filtesr

Many of the tokens have filters. The filters will show up as hints when you type in text in the inpux box above.
<activity video>,  <country oceania>, <firstname male>,
<noun ball> and many more. You can use space or dash
to separate tokens and filters so <activity video> and <activity-video>
are both valid.

Plural and conjugation

Tokens such as <noun>, <adv>, <place> (and more) can have a plural attribute. Eg:
<noun plural>, <adv plural>, <place plural>

Verbs can be conjugated by adding: simple, ing, ed, s, er, pp. Eg:
<verb ing> <verb ed>
<verb s> <verb er>
<verb violent er>
etc...

Rantjs

Rantjs is a procedural text generator. The goal is to augment human creativity with the boundless potential of randomness.

Examples

  • <noun vehicle plural> are <quality physical more> than <noun animal plural>, although slightly less <adj nsfw>
  • The <noun tool> in the <place building> made a noisy <sound>. You sigh <adv emotion> and get up to check it out. As you peer into the dimly lit enclosure, you <adv emotion> wonder what made the noise. You don't see anything, and conclude that it was probably just a <noun animal> scurrying about. You find that a couple of <noun tool plural> has been upended, so you set them straight. You turn around and start <verb walk ing> out, but freeze as you hear something <sound> behind you. What can it be?
  • [case:title][sep:n][rep:3]{I like <noun animal plural> but not <noun animal plural>}
  • The <adj nsfw> <noun nsfw> <adv sexy> <verb ed> the <adj nsfw> <noun insect>.
  • <firstname male> likes to <verb nsfw> <noun nsfw> with <pron poss male> pet <noun-animal>.
  • [case:word]<yn yes> <yn no>
  • <firstname male> likes to <verb-transitive> <noun.plural> with <pron poss male> pet <noun-animal> on <timenoun dayofweek plural>.
  • A random string: [rep:8][sep:\N]{\C}
  • The <adj> <noun> <adv> <verb.ed> the <adj> <noun> whilst <adv> being <verb ed>.
  • I like my <noun-shape>-shaped <noun-body.plural>

The project is based on Rant. This implementation is made to be included in JavaScript projects.

Rantjs is created and maintained by Sven A Robbestad

A note about NSFW words. These are not included in the default dictionary, so if you for instance type <noun> you will not get any NSFW nouns. You must explicitly ask for an NSFW word by typing <noun nsfw>.
